Posts.Content: Is it continuous, or more like 'pulsating' pain? I got the pulsating kind about two years after surgery, I've had it a couple of times since. A bit like someone sticking a needle at unregular intervals in the groin. My doctor thinks that it may be hernia, which sometimes follows surgery. If it is hernia, then further surgery is an option. If you find out some other reason, I'd be interested to hear about it.
Posts.Title: Need help for bad groin pain after prostate surgery

Posts.Title: Need help for bad groin pain after prostate surgery

Posts.Content: I am about the same age, also had both nerves spared. In the beginning it was hopeless, no action at all down there. I think it took me more than 6 months to get the little guy up and running again. I am also 'the king' with the pill, but not so great without it.
